role: Design and prototype the next-generation investigative infrastructure for public truth-seeking — transparent, decentralized, accountable, and free from institutional decay.
summary: ABI Lab is an open-source investigative laboratory focused on building transparent tools for understanding complex real-world cases, events, and systems. It provides infrastructure for evidence ingestion, timeline reconstructions, cross-source verification, and public audit trails — all without reliance on opaque governmental institutions. Think: investigative journalism meets advanced data science meets open governance.

pillars.purpose: Give everyone the ability to see the world as it is — through clear, verifiable investigative structure rather than institutional shadows.
pillars.methods: Open-source case modeling, public data ingestion, timeline engines, file integrity verification, sentiment/propaganda detection, multi-source triangulation, and cross-case pattern discovery.
pillars.outputs: Case files, investigative dashboards, public reports, explanation diagrams, cross-case matrices, anomaly detectors, and insight summaries.

roof: Intelligence Roof — ABI investigates reality, DCIA interprets meaning. Two wings, one mission.

projects.title: Universal Timeline Engine
projects.summary: A core ABI component: event tracking with timestamps, sources, evidence weight, contradictions, and uncertainty modeling. The backbone for every case.

projects.title: Open Case File Prototype
projects.summary: A transparent digital 'case folder' that holds evidence, media, statements, metadata, and machine-generated analysis — publicly auditable.

projects.title: Source Verification Chain
projects.summary: A cryptographic and procedural method to ensure source authenticity, detect doctored evidence, and assess reliability.

projects.title: Public Investigation Dashboard
projects.summary: Streamlit-powered interface showing case timelines, evidence cards, source maps, contradictions, and open leads.
